item.title: [WFLY-46] StatefulWithXPCFailoverTestCase intermittently fails
item.description:
org.jboss.as.test.clustering.cluster.ejb3.xpc.StatefulWithXPCFailoverTestCase(UDP).testBasicXPC

Failing for the past 1 build (Since #4179 )
Took 3 min 54 sec.
Error Message

assertExecuteUrlWithResult Timed out trying to execute url=http://127.0.0.1:8180/stateful/count?command=getEmployee, 2. started node2, xpc on node1, node1 should be able to read entity on node1
Stacktrace

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Works in my branch:

http://hudson.jboss.org/hudson/job/as7-param-pull/4971/testReport/org.jboss.as.test.clustering.cluster.ejb3.xpc/StatefulWithXPCFailoverTestCase(SYNC-tcp)/

However we are having problems with Infinispan https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ISPN-2572 that prevents merging the changes.

I ll take this on me to keep track.

From IRC discussion:

I saw the tcp-0 error "07:24:07,871 ERROR [org.infinispan.interceptors.InvocationContextInterceptor] (http-/127.0.0.1:8080-1) ISPN000136: Execution error: org.infinispan.remoting.transport.jgroups.SuspectException: Node node-1/web was suspected" around that same time in tcp-1, we look like we just shutdown some caches (shutdown is still in progress), infinispan rpcdispatcher but we should be starting up

It is likely that ContainerController.stop() needs to wait/block until AS is stopped before returning to us (or we need to simulate that).

A few different proposals:

  1. Change the test to sniff the AS logs for an indication that AS completed the shutdown or failed to shutdown (with a timeout so we don't wait forever).
  2. Change the ContainerController.stop() to block until AS is completely shutdown.
  3. something else
./target/jbossas-clustering-SYNC-tcp-1/standalone/log/server.log is attached which has Thread.dumpStack() output for when the AS is shutdown

I'll hack some AS shutdown code to dump the java threads and their call stacks in https://github.com/scottmarlow/jboss-as/tree/AS7-5209_hackonclustertest. If this works, we should see which threads exactly are not getting closed during the test.
The Windows faiures were fixed by AS7-6620. Closing!
